```
Shift4 Payments, LLC
2202 N. Irving St.
Allentown, PA 18109

September 12, 2019

Mr. Scott Calliham
[Redacted]

Re: Notice of Termination of the Reseller Agreement between CardConnect, LLC and
Shift4 Payments, LLC

Dear Scott,
This letter is formal notification that, pursuant to Section 7.2(b) of the Reseller Agreement
by and between CardConnect, LLC (“CardConnect”) and Shift4 Payments, LLC
(f/k/a Lighthouse Network, LLC) (“Shift4”), dated as of January 7, 2015 (the
“Reseller Agreement”), CardConnect desires to terminate the Reseller Agreement for the *
reasons stated herein.
Pursuant to Section 7.2(b) of the Reseller Agreement, the Reseller Agreement shall
terminate at the coordinate of 2 events, (i) 90 days after CardConnect provides written
notice to Shift4, and (ii) the expiration of CardConnect’s obligation to utilize Shift4 as its
exclusive provider under Section 1.1 of the Reseller Agreement.

As you are aware, CardConnect entered into the Reseller Agreement with Shift4
“contemporaneously” with a series of other agreements namely: (i) the Asset Purchase
Agreement, dated January 7, 2015, among Shift4 Payments, LLC and CardConnect and its
parent company, FinTech Acquisition Corporation, as well as (ii) the Mutual Non-
Solicitation and Confidentiality Agreement, dated as of January 7, 2015, by and between
CardConnect and Shift4, among others (collectively with the Reseller Agreement, the
“Transaction Agreements”).

As an initial matter, Shift4 breached its obligation under Section 5.19 (titled “No-Hire
Period”) of the Asset Purchase Agreement by soliciting and diverting CardConnect’s
personnel. In addition, CardConnect is aware that, despite the unambiguous requirements
of Section 5.1 of the Mutual Non-Solicitation and Confidentiality Agreement, Shift4 has
solicited or attempted to solicit CardConnect’s customers and referral sources, thereby
interfering with CardConnect’s business. In addition, there is evidence that Shift4 has also
breached the confidentiality obligations that Shift4 owes to CardConnect. These breaches
of the Transaction Agreements are grounds for termination. The foregoing breaches are
incorporated herein by reference to the demand letter sent under separate cover.
```

```
October 17, 2019

VIA EMAIL
Mr. Jeffrey Shanahan
President and Chief Executive Officer
CardConnect, LLC

Re: Demand that CardConnect, LLC Cease and Desist Breaches and Violations of
Contract and Tortious Interference – and Preserve All Documents Related to Shift4
Payments, LLC

Dear Jeff:
I am writing you on behalf of Shift4 Payments, LLC (f/k/a Lighthouse Network, LLC)
(“Shift4”) to demand that CardConnect, LLC (“CardConnect”) immediately cease and desist
from (i) further acts of tortious interference with Shift4’s contractual and business
relationships and (ii) making false, misleading, and defamatory statements regarding
Shift4. It has come to Shift4’s attention that CardConnect, including through its sales
representatives and other agents, has engaged in a campaign of disparaging Shift4, making
false and misleading statements about Shift4 to its existing joint customers, and inducing
those customers to breach or terminate their agreements with Shift4. This conduct is
unscrupulous and unlawful, and must be immediately addressed and discontinued.

As you are aware, CardConnect and Shift4 are parties to that certain Reseller Agreement,
dated as of January 7, 2015 (the “Reseller Agreement”), pursuant to which Shift4 provides
certain payment gateway and tokenization services to CardConnect for various merchants
(the “Merchants”). Capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined have the
meaning set forth in the Reseller Agreement. The Reseller Agreement remains in full force
and effect because, inter alia, CardConnect’s purported notice of termination failed to
comply with the express requirements of Section 7.2(b) (which is linked to the operational use
and exclusivity requirements of CardConnect in Section 1.1). Nevertheless, CardConnect
began informing Merchants in recent weeks that: (i) CardConnect has terminated the
Reseller Agreement; (ii) Shift4 “no longer adheres to PCI standards;” and (iii) CardConnect
has or shortly will transition the Merchants’ businesses entirely to CardConnect’s own
systems and platforms. None of this is true. Shift4 is, and has been for over 20 years, an
industry leader of security and an innovator of the most secure payments technologies,
including tokenization and point-to-point encryption. Any suggestion that Shift4 is not
compliant with PCI standards is knowingly false. Furthermore, the Reseller Agreement
has not been terminated, CardConnect has not complied with the 90 day notice provision,
and it remains in effect for all purposes.
```

```
Mr. Jeffrey Shanahan
October 17, 2019
Page 2

CardConnect's actions in urging Merchants to terminate their business and contractual
relationships with Shift4, combined with the false statements conveyed to the Merchants,
constitute tortious interference with Shift4's contractual and business relationships.
CardConnect also has exposed itself to significant liability under various federal and state
laws protecting businesses from unfair competition and false advertising.
In addition, the Reseller Agreement expressly requires CardConnect to use Shift4 as its
"exclusive provider" of Payment Gateway Services and Merchant Tokenization Services (as
defined therein)-a requirement that has an independent expiration to the termination
provisions of the Reseller Agreement. Nevertheless, CardConnect has taken numerous steps
to circumvent this provision and do business directly with Merchants, in violation of the
letter and spirit of its contractual obligations.

CardConnect must immediately cease and desist from spreading false information about
Shift4, contacting Shift4's Merchants to induce them to terminate their relationships with
Shift4, and otherwise interfering with Shift4's contractual and business relationships. Please
confirm in writing by October 21, 2019 that CardConnect will cease and desist from the
wrongful conduct described herein, and that it has informed its personnel to refrain from
engaging in such conduct going forward. Shift4 takes these issues seriously and will exercise
all available legal rights and remedies if CardConnect fails to immediately do so.
Pursuant to this demand, we further notify and remind CardConnect of its legal obligation
to preserve all hard copy and electronically stored information ("ESI") created by, or in the
possession, custody or control of CardConnect, that refers or relates, directly or indirectly,
to Shift4, including without limitation all ESI referring or relating to CardConnect's
communications, dealings and/or business with the Merchants.

Finally, it is my understanding that counsel for CardConnect and counsel for First Data
Merchant Services LLC ("First Data") and others from First Data management may seek to
attend conferences with Shift4 and one or more of the Merchants, to take place today and in
the coming days. As you may be aware, the Reseller Agreement contains a broad
confidentiality clause that, inter alia, expressly prohibits CardConnect from disclosing the
terms of the Reseller Agreement to any third parties, subject to limited exceptions that do
not apply here. See Section 5.1 of the Mutual Non-Solicitation and Confidentiality
Agreement. Accordingly, to avoid any violation of the foregoing restrictions, we request
that CardConnect personnel not attend or participate in any such conferences. We are happy
to schedule a separate briefing with CardConnect if desired.
```
